Executive Summary - 2009


The City of Wilson has implemented a comprehensive program to safely manage chlorine at its two (2) water treatment plants located in or adjacent to the City of Wilson. There have been no chlorine incidents in the most recent five-year history period.

In 1996, a Process Safety Management (PSM) program was initiated at the Plants. A PSM Implementation Manual was edited to be site specific for each Water Plant. The Manual was issued to the plants. In 1999 the Manual was expanded to address the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP).

Key items included in the updated manual are:

o A written Management Program defining the positions and individuals responsible for implementing the RMP and PSM regulations

o Written site specific procedures for Employee Involvement, Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Pre-Startup Reviews and Self Audits

o Chlorine safety information as required by the regulations

o Standard Operating Procedures for safe Chlorine Management

o A Mechanical Integrity Program for chlorine equipment 

o An Emergency Response Plan to address chlorine emergencies and offsite response and communication

Next, these steps have been continually implemented to maintain compliance with the PMP/PSM program.

O  Training on RMP/PSM and its key components including Management of Change, Mechanical Integrity and Incident Investigation;

o Conducting periodically Process Hazards Analyses for the two chlorine processes;

o Implementing the Mechanical Integrity Program for chlorine regulators, controls and material handling equipments such as cranes

o Conducting Self Audits to review compliance with the elements of RMP and PSM

o Chlorine Response Drills have been routinely conducted since 1998.
o Performing an annual review of our Chlorine Operating Procedures

The Assistant Director of Public Services / Water Resources, Water Treatment Manager, Maintenance Supervisor and several plant operators

and mechanics meet at least one time per year to review and update procedures and to develop a schedule to maintain compliance with all aspects of the RMP/PSM regulation.

In addition to PSM compliance, the plants have implemented or are considering a number of programs to improve the safe handling of chlorine.

-Chlorine leak detection alarm systems have been upgraded at both plants. These systems will allow an early detection of and response to any chlorine leak.

- Cameras have been added at both plants for visual inspection of the tanks and pressurized feed systems.  Additional fencing around the chlorine area has been installed at the Wiggins Mill Plant and Toisnot Plants
        
In addition to Process Safety Management, the organization has an active safety program. The City of Wilson has had an active Safety Committee. The committee meets monthly with representatives from each function and each site. The committee's duties include reviewing new safety procedures, accident investigations, safety surveys and safety communications.

Within the Water Treatment Division, there are monthly safety meetings to review an OSHA subject or discuss a safety issue. Routine training is conducted for topics such as:

- Hazard Communications

- Personal Protective Equipment

- Lockout/Tagout

- Confined Space

As a result of our programs, the plants have had a strong safety record with no loss time accident over the past three years. We plan to continue our emphasis on safety to maintain and improve our safety performance.
